details.title: Terahertz Generation and Detection Using Low Temperature Grown InGaAs-InAlAs Photoconductive Antennas at 1.55 Pulse Excitation
details.abstract: Photoconductive antennas fabricated on novel low temperature (LT) beryllium (Be) doped InGaAs-InAlAs multi-quantum-well structures have been evaluated as THz emitters and detectors in a time-domain spectroscopy (TDS) system. We present system responses with THz pulses having spectral range up to 3 THz and power to noise ratio of 60 dB, making them competitive with LT-GaAs excited at 800 nm and among the highest reported to date for this material system.
details.journal_title: IEEE Transactions on Terahertz Science and Technology
details.sponsor: IEEE Microwave Theory and Techniques Society

keywords: novel low temperature beryllium doped multiquantum-well structure
